meanings.definition: The permanently inhabited portion of the earth.
meanings.sent1: The ecumene includes all the places where people live.
meanings.sent2: Explorers traveled far and wide to discover new parts of the ecumene.
meanings.sent3: In the ecumene, cities bustle with activity while nature thrives.
meanings.sent4: Her love for travel made her feel like a citizen of the ecumene.
meanings.sent5: The ecumene is like a colorful patchwork quilt of human civilization.

meanings.sent1: People from different cultures come together in the ecumene.
meanings.sent2: The ecumene is vast and diverse, with many languages spoken.
meanings.sent3: Even in the vastness of the ecumene, friends can find each other.
meanings.sent4: His dreams took him to far corners of the ecumene every night.
meanings.sent5: The ecumene is a tapestry woven with threads of different traditions.
